verses.kjv: IT IS A GOOD THING TO GIVE THANKS UNTO THE LORD, AND TO SING PRAISES UNTO THY NAME, O MOST HIGH:
verses.ct: It is wonderful to give thanks to the LORD, and to sing praises to your name, Most High —

verses.kjv: To shew forth thy lovingkindness in the morning, and thy faithfulness every night,
verses.ct: to declare your faithful love in the morning, and your reliability every night,

verses.kjv: Upon an instrument of ten strings, and upon the psaltery; upon the harp with a solemn sound.
verses.ct: with a 10-stringed instrument, with the lute, and with the deep melody of the harp.

verses.kjv: For thou, LORD, hast made me glad through thy work: I will triumph in the works of thy hands.
verses.ct: Because you, LORD, have filled me with joy through what you have done; I celebrate the work of your hands.

verses.kjv: O LORD, how great are thy works! and thy thoughts are very deep.
verses.ct: LORD, how magnificent are your works! Your plans are incredibly profound.

verses.kjv: A brutish man knoweth not; neither doth a fool understand this.
verses.ct: A senseless person doesn't recognize this; a fool cannot grasp it.

verses.kjv: When the wicked spring as the grass, and when all the workers of iniquity do flourish; it is that they shall be destroyed for ever:
verses.ct: Though the wicked sprout up like grass, and all who practice evil seem to thrive, they are headed for permanent destruction.

verses.kjv: But thou, LORD, art most high for evermore.
verses.ct: But you, LORD, are exalted forever.

verses.kjv: For, lo, thine enemies, O LORD, for, lo, thine enemies shall perish; all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.
verses.ct: Look — your enemies, LORD, look — your enemies will be destroyed; all who practice evil will be scattered.

verses.kjv: But my horn shalt thou exalt like the horn of an unicorn: I shall be anointed with fresh oil.
verses.ct: But you have lifted my strength like that of a wild ox; you have poured fresh oil over me.

verses.kjv: Mine eye also shall see my desire on mine enemies, and mine ears shall hear my desire of the wicked that rise up against me.
verses.ct: My eyes will witness the downfall of my enemies, and my ears will hear the defeat of those wicked people who rise against me.

verses.kjv: The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree: he shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
verses.ct: Those who are righteous will thrive like a palm tree; they will grow tall like a cedar in Lebanon.

verses.kjv: Those that be planted in the house of the LORD shall flourish in the courts of our God.
verses.ct: Planted in the house of the LORD, they will thrive in the courts of our God.

verses.kjv: They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be fat and flourishing;
verses.ct: They will still produce fruit in old age; they will remain healthy and full of life —

verses.kjv: To shew that the LORD is upright: he is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.
verses.ct: showing that the LORD is just. He is my rock, and there is no wrongdoing in him.
